Arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the Channel.

Id.description:
The ID of the Channel. The ID must be unique within the region and it
cannot be changed after a Channel is created.

CreateOriginEndpointRequest.description: Configuration parameters used to create a new OriginEndpoint.

ChannelId.description:
The ID of the Channel that the OriginEndpoint will be associated with.
This cannot be changed after the OriginEndpoint is created.

Description.description: A short text description of the OriginEndpoint.

Id.description:
The ID of the OriginEndpoint.  The ID must be unique within the region
and it cannot be changed after the OriginEndpoint is created.

ManifestName.description: A short string that will be used as the filename of the OriginEndpoint URL (defaults to "index").

StartoverWindowSeconds.description:
Maximum duration (seconds) of content to retain for startover playback.
If not specified, startover playback will be disabled for the OriginEndpoint.

TimeDelaySeconds.description:
Amount of delay (seconds) to enforce on the playback of live content.
If not specified, there will be no time delay in effect for the OriginEndpoint.

Whitelist.description: A list of source IP CIDR blocks that will be allowed to access the OriginEndpoint.

CreateOriginEndpointRequest.title: CreateOriginEndpointRequest

Arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the OriginEndpoint.

ChannelId.description: The ID of the Channel the OriginEndpoint is associated with.

Description.description: A short text description of the OriginEndpoint.

ManifestName.description: A short string appended to the end of the OriginEndpoint URL.

StartoverWindowSeconds.description:
Maximum duration (seconds) of content to retain for startover playback.
If not specified, startover playback will be disabled for the OriginEndpoint.

TimeDelaySeconds.description:
Amount of delay (seconds) to enforce on the playback of live content.
If not specified, there will be no time delay in effect for the OriginEndpoint.

Url.description: The URL of the packaged OriginEndpoint for consumption.

Whitelist.description: A list of source IP CIDR blocks that will be allowed to access the OriginEndpoint.

DashEncryption.description: A Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) encryption configuration.

KeyRotationIntervalSeconds.description: Time (in seconds) between each encryption key rotation.

DashEncryption.title: DashEncryption

DashPackage.description: A Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) packaging configuration.

ManifestWindowSeconds.description: Time window (in seconds) contained in each manifest.

MinBufferTimeSeconds.description: Minimum duration (in seconds) that a player will buffer media before starting the presentation.

MinUpdatePeriodSeconds.description: Minimum duration (in seconds) between potential changes to the Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) Media Presentation Description (MPD).

Profile.description: The Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) profile type.  When set to "HBBTV_1_5", HbbTV 1.5 compliant output is enabled.

SegmentDurationSeconds.description:
Duration (in seconds) of each segment. Actual segments will be
rounded to the nearest multiple of the source segment duration.

SuggestedPresentationDelaySeconds.description: Duration (in seconds) to delay live content before presentation.

DashPackage.title: DashPackage

Description.description: A short text description of the Channel.

ChannelId.description: The ID of the Channel the OriginEndpoint is associated with.

StartoverWindowSeconds.description:
Maximum duration (seconds) of content to retain for startover playback.

TimeDelaySeconds.description:

ForbiddenException.description: The client is not authorized to access the requested resource.
ForbiddenException.title: ForbiddenException

HlsEncryption.description: An HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) encryption configuration.

ConstantInitializationVector.description:
A constant initialization vector for encryption (optional).
When not specified the initialization vector will be periodically rotated.

KeyRotationIntervalSeconds.description: Interval (in seconds) between each encryption key rotation.

RepeatExtXKey.description: When enabled, the EXT-X-KEY tag will be repeated in output manifests.

HlsEncryption.title: HlsEncryption

HlsIngest.description: An HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) ingest resource configuration.

IngestEndpoints.description: A list of endpoints to which the source stream should be sent.

HlsIngest.title: HlsIngest

HlsPackage.description: An HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) packaging configuration.

AdMarkers.description:
This setting controls how ad markers are included in the packaged OriginEndpoint.
"NONE" will omit all SCTE-35 ad markers from the output.
"PASSTHROUGH" causes the manifest to contain a copy of the SCTE-35 ad
markers (comments) taken directly from the input HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest.
"SCTE35_ENHANCED" generates ad markers and blackout tags based on SCTE-35
messages in the input source.

IncludeIframeOnlyStream.description: When enabled, an I-Frame only stream will be included in the output.

PlaylistType.description:
The HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) playlist type.
When either "EVENT" or "VOD" is specified, a corresponding EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE
entry will be included in the media playlist.

PlaylistWindowSeconds.description: Time window (in seconds) contained in each parent manifest.

ProgramDateTimeIntervalSeconds.description:
The interval (in seconds) between each EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag
inserted into manifests. Additionally, when an interval is specified
ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated every 5 seconds using the 
ingest time of the content.
If the interval is not specified, or set to 0, then
no EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tags will be inserted into manifests and no
ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated. Note that irrespective
of this parameter, if any ID3 Timed Metadata is found in HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) input,
it will be passed through to HLS output.

SegmentDurationSeconds.description:
Duration (in seconds) of each fragment. Actual fragments will be
rounded to the nearest multiple of the source fragment duration.

UseAudioRenditionGroup.description: When enabled, audio streams will be placed in rendition groups in the output.

HlsPackage.title: HlsPackage

IngestEndpoint.description: An endpoint for ingesting source content for a Channel.

Password.description: The system generated password for ingest authentication.

Url.description: The ingest URL to which the source stream should be sent.

Username.description: The system generated username for ingest authentication.

IngestEndpoint.title: IngestEndpoint

NextToken.description: A token that can be used to resume pagination from the end of the collection.
A token that can be used to resume pagination from the end of the collection.

MssEncryption.description: A Microsoft Smooth Streaming (MSS) encryption configuration.
MssEncryption.title: MssEncryption

MssPackage.description: A Microsoft Smooth Streaming (MSS) packaging configuration.

ManifestWindowSeconds.description: The time window (in seconds) contained in each manifest.

SegmentDurationSeconds.description: The duration (in seconds) of each segment.

MssPackage.title: MssPackage

StreamOrder.description: A directive that determines the order of streams in the output.
